page.description: A Namespace is a collection of data types. Data types are organized into 5 groups.

item.name: Pointer
item.description: P - a reference to an instance

item.name: Function Pointer
item.description: F - a reference to a function

item.name: Enumeration
item.description: A set of named values. See Enumeration Example below.

section.title: Enumeration Example
section.description: The following is an example of an enumeration:
section.example: dim t as SQL::TableType t = View ' the name of the SQL::TableType enumeration ? t = 1 'the numeric value of the enumeration

section.title: Another Example

description.p: The default Alpha Anywhere namespace provides access to the data types, functions, and methods documented in Variable Data Types, Xbasic Functions Listed Alphabetically and Xbasic Methods Listed Alphabetically.
The SQL namespace provides access to a rich group of classes that allow you to read and write to other databases.

section.example: dim conn as SQL::Connection dim expr as SQL::Query::ValueExpression
section.note: Many namespaces, classes, and enumerations are reserved for internal use only.
